thread.title: Rand loses ground in muted trade | Markets
thread.title_full: Rand loses ground in muted trade | Markets | BDlive

author: Maarten Mittner
title: Rand loses ground in muted trade | Markets
text:
Picture: GALLO IMAGES/FOTO24/LOANNA HOFFMAN THE rand was slightly weaker at midday on Monday as the local currency pulled back from exaggerated trading levels on Friday.
At 11.29am the rand was at R12.7099 from a previous close of R12.6745.
Against the euro the rand was at R13.9501 from a previous R13.9079 and it was trading at R19.8485 against the British pound from R19.8169.
The euro was at $1.0976 from $1.0975.
The rand strengthened on Friday on disappointing US wage data, but could not hold on to the firmer levels.
Standard Bank trader Warrick Butler said trading was fairly muted due to holidays in the Northern Hemisphere.
"The last day of last month was a typical month-end coupled with Friday mess. Liquidity over the fixings was shocking and saw the rand hit a firmer level of R12.5810 before closing back up near R12.6800," he said.
He expected the rand to be range-bound for the day between R12.64 and R12.77 to the dollar. There are plenty of country-specific manufacturing data out on Monday, which "could give us further clues as to the state of global growth".
"Pretty poor" data would affect both risky assets and commodity-based currencies, such as the rand, Mr Butler said.
